Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Binds to mRNA to regulate post-transcriptional activity. Affects glycogen biosynthesis, gluconeogenesis, cell size and surface properties. Regulates glycogen synthesis under both aerobic and anaerobic conditions. Seems to accelerate the degradation of glg gene transcripts, potentially through selective RNA binding. Acts to inhibit interaction between the LetD protein and the A subunit of DNA gyrase. Also required for motility and flagellum biosynthesis through the post-transcriptional activation of flhDC expression. This involves binding to and stabilization of the flhDC message by CsrA. Binds to and reduces levels of probable diguanylate cyclases ycdT and ydeH.

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an RNA molecule or a portion thereof.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with the 5' untranslated region of an mRNA molecule.

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of translational initiation.
Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of the chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of glycogen.
BioProcess.Keyword: Negative regulation of glycogen biosynthetic process

BioProcess.Detail: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the breakdown of mRNA, messenger RNA, which is responsible for carrying the coded genetic 'message', transcribed from DNA, to sites of protein assembly at the ribosomes.

PDB.PDB_Title: Solution structure of the Carbon Storage Regulator protein CsrA
PDB.PubMed_Title: Solution structure of the carbon storage regulator protein CsrA from Escherichia coli.
PDB.Author: Gutierrez, P., et al.
